nodes.content: The bartender told me to ask about your business...?

A man with graying hair sits alone in the corner of this tavern, slowly sipping a mug of ale and staring out the window to the south, deep in his own thoughts.  When you approach, he does not look up, but says, "What do you folks want?"
'Why don't you mind your own business, huh?  I'm not asking for your names.'
Can you tell me about Hartfyord?
'Do I look like a tour guide?  Get lost.'

For the first time, he turns to face you.  Only slightly though, an eye briefly appraising each of you, then he looks back out the window.  'Olga likes you huh?  I bet you just bought her ale and she got excited.'  He takes a sip of his own mug.  'I'm not that easy to please.  If you really want to know about my business, you'll have to prove yourself a bit.'

'Bring me a certain something from the Blackford manor.  A book.  Titled "Be Wary; The King."  They've got a huge library, you'll just have to go search it for the book.  If you bring me that, then maybe I'll tell you a bit about myself, if you really want to know.'
Here is your book, "Be Wary; The King".

'Ahh,' he says with mild surprise.  You drop the book on the table, and he turns fully around in his chair.  You see that right side of his face is completely scarred; the eye looks like it is barely sunken into his face.  He looks down at the book and nods.  'That's what I asked form alright.'  Carefully, he picks the book up and puts it in his coat.

'Allow me to introduce myself formally.  I am Creighton Bedford.  I am a Controller.'  He smiles when you look confused.  'Carrion Valley is potentially a very lucrative place.  A family could grow very powerful here in a very short amount of time, given the right circumstances.'

'This situation is not desirable for many families who do not have the opportunities that the Blackfords and the Whitelins have.  This is only worsened by Lord Guildimarch's illicit monitoring of the area.  You see now that there's room for certain people who would inhibit this growth.  To allow time for certain negotiations to be made.'

'I am one such person.  It can be very lucrative, provided you are secretive enough, and you don't get yourself caught.  If you are interested in such jobs, I can provide them for you.  All you need do is ask for a Controller job.'
Come back later, and I'll give you one.
